items.sentence: Tom couldn\'t understand why Mary wanted to stay at home.
Tom seemed to be unaware that Mary hadn\'t yet done that.
Tom seems to take it for granted that he\'ll get the job.
Tom shared his mother\'s oatmeal cookie recipe with Mary.
Tom should be home by now, but he\'s still at his office.
Tom has lost a lot of hair since the last time I saw him.
Tom has no idea where Mary is planning to stay in Boston.
Tom has put on some weight since the last time I saw him.
Tom has to work harder than he used to to make ends meet.
If there\'s something bothering you, you need to tell me.
I\'ve already talked to Tom a couple of times about that.
It won\'t be necessary for us to come back here tomorrow.
Tom finally got the courage to propose to his girlfriend.
Tom fired Mary because she often showed up late for work.
Tom can\'t quite bring himself to tell Mary he loves her.
Tom left three hours ago so he should\'ve arrived by now.
Tom couldn\'t accomplish everything he\'d hoped he could.
I want you to know that I really didn\'t want to do that.
I want you to tell them I didn\'t do what you said I did.
I wanted to ask Tom if he\'d ever consider changing jobs.
I wanted to thank you for everything you\'ve done for me.
Don\'t read what\'s in the envelope. Just give it to Tom.
I thought you said we weren\'t going to complain anymore.
I told Tom he didn\'t need to come into the office today.
Tom won\'t be able to do everything Mary asked him to do.
Tom won\'t tell me how much he paid for his new computer.
I\'d like to exchange this shirt that I bought yesterday.
I\'d like to give Tom something special for his birthday.
I\'ll call you when I get the results of the examination.
I\'m not even going to try to talk Tom out of doing that.
Benjamin Franklin was an American statesman and inventor.
Children imitate their friends rather than their parents.
Do we really want to spend the entire weekend doing this?
Have you been threatened or coerced into pleading guilty?
Tom grew up in an isolated village deep in the mountains.
Tom had enough sense to not go out by himself after dark.
Tom has an important decision to make before next Monday.
Tom heard a knock and walked over to the door to open it.
If you had stuck around, you would have had a lot of fun.
If you would move over, there would be room for everyone.
In 1994, there was a shortage of water and rice in Japan.
Is it true short people need more sleep than tall people?
Tom said to tell you he\'s sorry he can\'t be here today.
Don\'t you think you\'ll move back to Boston, eventually?
You should rewrite this sentence. It doesn\'t make sense.
You\'d better not tell Tom about what Mary did yesterday.
You\'d better take an umbrella with you in case it rains.
Why does the phone always ring when I\'m taking a shower?
Why don\'t you and I continue this discussion in private?
Why don\'t you calm down and tell me what the problem is?
